intro: Is your phone not sending pictures through text message? This is an incredibly frustrating situation, especially if your regular text messages are still going through. In this article we'll go over 10 troubleshooting steps you can take to fix this issue on both iPhone and Android devices.

steps.title: Check to make sure you can send MMS messages.
steps.subtitle: Texts with images are considered "MMS" messages. If your phone's settings have MMS messaging disabled, you won't be able to send text messages with images in them.

steps.title: Make sure your cellular data is enabled.
steps.subtitle: In order to send and receive any messages (SMS or MMS), you'll need to be on an active cellular network. If your cellular data was turned off for some reason, this would impact your phone's ability to send an MMS.

points.name: Force Stop or Restart Messages App

steps.title: Restart your messaging app to clear out glitches or bugs.
steps.subtitle: Sometimes, random glitches or bugs can occur that cause software to stop working properly. These glitches can usually be fixed by restarting the app. If you have an Android, you can also force stop an app and restart it.
sub-points: On iPhone, swipe up from the bottom of the screen (if you don't have a home button) or double tap the home button to view your open apps. Swipe up on the Messages app to close it, then reopen it and try again.
On Android, open your settings app and go to your apps section. Navigate to the Messages app in this menu, then tap . You can then relaunch the app and try again.

steps.title: Try restarting your phone if an app restart doesn't fix the issue.
steps.subtitle: Much like restarting an app, restarting your phone can clear out bugs and glitches that cause your device to not work properly. If restarting the app doesn't fix your inability to send pictures in text messages, try restarting your entire phone.
sub-points: On iPhones without a home button, press and hold either volume button and the side button until the power-off slider appears.

On iPhones with a home button, press just the side button until the power-off slider appears. Slide the slider, then wait 30 seconds before turning your device back on by pressing the side button for about three seconds.
While each Android phone may vary depending on model, most can be restarted by holding the power button and selecting .

steps.title: Clear the Messages app cache to weed out bad or corrupted data.
steps.subtitle: Caches can sometimes become corrupted, which can lead to apps and services not working as intended.
sub-points: Unfortunately, iPhone users can't clear an app's cache the same as Android. You can usually clear the cache by uninstalling the app and reinstalling it, but the Messages app can't be uninstalled as it's part of iOS.

While steps may vary slightly depending on your Android model, you can clear your Messages app cache by long-pressing on the Messages app and tapping  >  and then toggling on "Unrestricted Data Usage."
